column4: How can I determine what section a certain package belongs to? For example, what section belongs the package »sudoku« to?
'~$ dpkg -S /usr/games/sudoku; sudoku: /usr/games/sudoku.' I infer that you did not give me a proper answer.
no, it means that that file /usr/games/sudoku comes from the package "sudoku"  (the first word in the output)
But I did not aks for a package but for a section.
right, I'm sorry I misread your question. What kind of "section" are you referring to?
Ubuntu divides all packages that it odffers in "sections". You can find a button "Section" on the left-hand pane in Synaptic. For example a valid section is "Amateur Radio (universe)".
oh right. I'm not sure how to do that in terminal. But you can ask ubottu (here in irc) bye typing /msg ubottu !info sudoku
This command provides the 'component' but not the 'section'.
ok, sorry. Than I don't know how to list what you need..
I think I found what you're after. It's through the dpkg-query command:   dpkg-query -W -f='${PackageSpec} ${Version}\t${Section}\n' sudoku
'~$ dpkg-query -W -f='${PackageSpec} ${Version}\t${Section}\n' sudoku; No packages found matching sudoku.' What should I substitute for '{PackageSpec}'?
I tried this, and this should be the actual command (no substitutions required). No packages found , normally means that the package 'sudoku' is not installed. Is it currently?
you could try this with an other package you have installed? (pick any package from the output of dpkg -l)
I made a mistake. I entered this command in a computer where the package sudoku was not installed. --  My apologies. --  Thank you very much for your help.
